thread.title: Wayne Rooney back in training as Manchester United put finishing touches to preparations for Saint-Etienne clash
thread.title_full: Wayne Rooney back in training as Manchester United put finishing touches to preparations for Saint-Etienne clash

author: dwright
title: Wayne Rooney back in training as Manchester United put finishing touches to preparations for Saint-Etienne clash
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments WAYNE ROONEY was back in training today as Manchester United put the finishing touches to their preparations for the Europa League clash with Saint-Etienne. 
Rooney was absent from Carrington on Monday after he was forced to undergo emergency surgery on a root canal problem. Reuters 8 Wayne Rooney joined Ashley Young in training a day after root canal surgery 
Manager Jose Mourinho even admitted the England captain could be a doubt for Sunday’s EFL Cup Final against Southampton. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But those fears now look to have been misplaced after the striker joined his teammates in full training ahead of United’s Europa League game on Wednesday in France. Reuters Luke Shaw was hard at work in training as he hopes for the chance to face Southampton Reuters 8 Jose Mourinho showed no sign of any pressure as he joked around in training 
United hold a 3-0 lead going into the second-leg, and boss Mourinho will not want to risk any of his players getting injured and being ruled out of Wembley this weekend. 
United made the short trip out to the Rhone Valley after they trained, with players and staff in a relaxed mood. 
However Rooney did not travel with the squad, along with Luke Shaw. PA:Press Association Paul Pogba shares a joke with Jose Mourinho and his assistant Rui Faria Getty Images Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Marouaine Fellaini go through their paces in training before making the journey to France Manchester United star Zlatan Ibrahimovic scores one-touch winner against Blackburn Getty Images 8 Zlatan Ibrahimovic keeps himself warm in training at Carrington 
Ashley Young is in contention for a starting role as Mourinho's side look to book a place in the last 16. 
But Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Paul Pogba could be left on the bench in order to protect them ahead of the EFL Cup, which could see Mourinho win his first trophy as United boss. 
The United squad heading to St Etienne: De Gea, O'Hara, Romero, Bailly, Blind, Fosu-Mensah, Rojo, Smalling, Valencia, Young, Carrick, Fellaini, Mata, Mkhitaryan, Pogba, Lingard, Schweinsteiger, Ibrahimovic, Martial, Rashford.
